component:ember-ux-sauce/components/uxs-.title: UXS Button
component:ember-ux-sauce/components/uxs-.text: A component to render a simple button {{uxs-button "BUTTON TEXT"}}

attributes.name: UXS Button
attributes.description:
A component to render a simple button

{{uxs-button "BUTTON TEXT"}}

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
Set to true to disable this button.

This will activate it's disabled style and also prevent any actions from being fired.

arguments.name: inline
arguments.description: Set to true to enable the button to appear inline with other buttons or inline components. The button will use the inline-block display property.

arguments.name: loading
arguments.description:
Set to true if the button has already been pressed or should be disabled while another action takes place.

If the loadingText argument has been provided this will be displayed, defaults to "Loading".

This will activate it's loading style and also prevent any actions from being fired..

arguments.name: mini
arguments.description:
Deprecated

Use the size="small" argument instead.

arguments.name: naked
arguments.description: Strip away any background styles and just display the buttons text.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
Add a custom name to your button, used for aria labels & test selectors.

By default this will be the same as the text argument unless you parse a different value.

arguments.name: selected
arguments.description:
Set's the button style to a selected state.

Can be used to toggle buttons or to infer an active state without disabling the buttons action.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description:
Set the size of the button. Default is medium.

UXS ships with the following stock sizes: giant, huge, large, medium, small, tiny.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-massive-size

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the button.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-custom-style

arguments.name: text
arguments.description:
The buttons text, this can be set as the first positional parameter.

It will also default to the components name.

component:ember-ux-sauce/components/uxs-.title: UXS Button Group
component:ember-ux-sauce/components/uxs-.text: A component to render group of buttons {{#uxs-button-group align=align disabled=disabled padded=padded row=row style=style as |group| }} {{group.button "Save" style="primary"}} {{group.button "Save & Publish" style="primary"}} {{group.link "Cancel" "docs.forms.buttons" style="warning"}} {{/uxs-button-group}}

attributes.name: UXS Button Group
attributes.description:
A component to render group of buttons

{{#uxs-button-group
  align=align
  disabled=disabled
  padded=padded
  row=row
  style=style
  as |group|
}}
  {{group.button "Save" style="primary"}}
  {{group.button "Save & Publish" style="primary"}}
  {{group.link "Cancel" "docs.forms.buttons" style="warning"}}
{{/uxs-button-group}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The base css class name 'uxs-tabs'

arguments.name: align
arguments.description:
Set the alignment of the buttons. This will only take effect if the group is in column layout (row=false)

UXS ships with three align options: left, center (default) & right

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
Set to true to disable all buttons in the group.

This will activate it's disabled style and also prevent any actions from being fired and links working.

arguments.name: padded
arguments.description: Set to true to add some horizontal padding to the group

arguments.name: row
arguments.description: Set to true to display child buttons in a row instead of a column

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the groups background.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-tabs--my-custom-style

arguments.description: Set to true to display a single style pane

arguments.name: splash
arguments.description: Set to true to display a splash style pane

arguments.name: split
arguments.description: Set to true to display a split style pane

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the panes background.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: primary, accent, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-pane--my-custom-style

arguments.name: type
arguments.description:
Set the type of pane, an alternative to using the bolean arguments for main, aside etc

UXS ships with the following stock pane types: aside, detail, index, main, single, splash & split.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .uxs-pane--my-custom-type

template:application-tailwind.title: Your Tailwind styles
template:application-tailwind.text: Your Tailwind styles A reference for every generated class in your app.

template:docs/components/avatars.title: Avatars
template:docs/components/avatars.text: Avatars Avatars are used to display images of users or resources. Simple Usage Avatars come in different shapes & sizes. Properties Now explore the various properties available in this component: size* String Possible Values: small, medium, large, huge, giant round Boolean border Boolean Styles Usage You can customise the look of your lists with the style attribute.

template:docs/components/datalists.title: Datalist
template:docs/components/datalists.text: Datalist Datalist are used to display record details, think of them as readonly form controls. To see a full list of arguments check out the api page Simple List Usage The Datalist Item A Datalist consists of items displaying a label and value. If the value is empty an "empty" string can be provided. To see a full list of arguments for items check out the api page Testable Elements This component provides the following test selectors. data-test-datalist data-test-datalist-item data-test-datalist-label data-test-datalist-row data-test-datalist-value data-test-datalist-tip Styles Usage You can customise the look of your datalist with the style attribute.

template:docs/components/icons.title: Icons
template:docs/components/icons.text: Icons The icon component is used to render icons from the Material Icons font library. To see a full list of arguments check out the api page Simple Usage Let's look at a basic example of a name control where you require two inputs to sit alongside each other Action Usage You can pass action closures to icons Testable Elements This component provides the following test selectors. data-test-icon

template:docs/components/lists.title: Avatars and Actions
template:docs/components/lists.text: Avatars and Actions This is a list that includes some horizontal layout for the avatar and item. We use the aside and body contextual components to split up each items layout. Icon Avatars You can use icons for the list items avatar. Text Avatars You can use text for the list items avatar too. Styles Usage You can customise the look of your lists with the style attribute. List Notices Contextual Components The List Item component has the following child components: aside Alias of uxs-div, used to seperate horizontal layout blocks body Alias of uxs-div, used to seperate horizontal layout blocks, unlike aside, this component will grow to fill the available width title Alias of content Alias of detail Alias of avatar Alias of action Alias of

template:docs/components/menus.title: Menus
template:docs/components/menus.text: Menus Simple Usage Two simple examples. The menu widths adjusts to accommodate the content in keyline increments. Disabled Items The disabled property disables a Menu Item. The Divider can be used to separate MenuItems. Icons Menu items supports icons through the leftIcon and rightIcon attributes. Secondary Text Menu Items support a secondaryText attribute. Subheadings Menu Items can include subheadings to split up items. Dropdown Menu You can use the basic dropdown component to display menus in your app. Normal nav item And another This one is a link Icon Dropdown Menu This is a menu with an icon trigger. Normal nav item And another This one is a link Styles Usage You can customise the look of your menu with the style attribute.

template:docs/components/notice.title: Notice
template:docs/components/notice.text: Notice This component can be used to display notices to the use in a variaty of styles... Simple Usage Let's look at a basic example of a notice. Properties Now explore the various properties available in this component: text* String style String truncated Boolean Usage with Icons You can also intergrate icons in a notice. Usage with Links Links & buttons can be included in a notice.

template:docs/components/pagination.title: Pagination
template:docs/components/pagination.text: Pagination The pagination component provides control for a paginated json api response. To see a full list of arguments check out the api page Basic Usage This example calls a controller action with the current page size and results. Testable Elements This component provides the following test selectors. data-test-pagination data-test-pagination-label data-test-pagination-result-limit data-test-pagination-prev data-test-pagination-next All the styles Behold.

template:docs/components/pills.title: Pills
template:docs/components/pills.text: Pills Pills are comenly used to display tags or inline statuses. They are usually colored to reflect their content. Simple Usage Let's look at a basic example of a pill. Properties Now explore the various properties available in this component: text* String style String size String rounded Boolean Pill Sizes Pills are available in a variaty of sizes. Tiny Small Medium Large Huge Giant Pills With Icons Add icons to your pills.

template:docs/components/preamble.title: Preamble
template:docs/components/preamble.text: Preamble This component can be used to display some key info to a user before the main content is displayed. Simple Usage Let's look at a basic example with an icon and text message. Custom Usage Let's look at a basic example with an icon and text message.

template:docs/components/splash.title: Splash
template:docs/components/splash.text: Splash Splash messages are a nice way to inform the user of a unique event in a friendly manner. e.g. Reaching Inbox Zero! The Usage Let's look at a basic example. You can play around with some of the arguments in this demo. To see a full list check out the api page Explanation, uxs-splash is the wrapping component The contextual component splash.icon is an alias to uxs-icon component to display an icon. The contextual component splash.title is an alias to uxs-subheading component for the splash title. The contextual component splash.text is an alias to uxs-content component for the splash text.

template:docs/forms/button-groups.title: Button Groups
template:docs/forms/button-groups.text: Button Groups The button group component is used to render a group of buttons and control their layout. Usage Let's look at a basic example. You can play around with some of the arguments in this demo. To see a full list check out the api page

template:docs/forms/button-links.title: Button Links
template:docs/forms/button-links.text: Button Links The button-link component is like the button component but extends the Ember link-to component so you can link to other routes Usage Let's look at a basic example. This button links to the quickstart route. You can play around with some of the arguments in this demo. To see a full list check out the api page Inline Buttons By default link-buttons will be displayed as block items. To set them as inline pass true to the inline argument. Because button links extend from the link-to component their active (selected) state will be detected automatically. Stock Style Examples Here's an example of the button in all it's stock styles: Stock Size Examples Here's an example of the button in all it's stock sizes:

template:docs/forms/buttons.title: Buttons
template:docs/forms/buttons.text: Buttons The button component is used for clickable actions. This could be to submit a form or to trigger an ember action. Usage Let's look at a basic example. You can play around with some of the arguments in this demo. To see a full list check out the api page Actions The button component fires an action on tap/click. Actions are passed as closure actions. The action will not be fired if the component is disabled or in a loading state. Inline Buttons By default buttons will be displayed as block items. To set them as inline pass true to the inline argument. Stock Style Examples Here's an example of the button in all it's stock styles: Stock Size Examples Here's an example of the button in all it's stock sizes:

template:docs/forms/controls.title: Form Controls
template:docs/forms/controls.text: Form Controls The form control component is used as a container for a form input, label, validation & other common form UI. Common Usage Let's look at a common example where we define the controls child elements through properties: Custom Usage Although the above should cover 90% of your common use cases, we can customise the control with contextual components:

template:docs/forms/date-time-inputs.title: Form Date & Time Inputs
template:docs/forms/date-time-inputs.text: Form Date & Time Inputs The form dat & time input component extends from the FlatPickr addon component. As such you can pass any of it's attributes attributes Basic Usage Let's look at a basic example with a change action called when changing the value. The value of a datetime input should be one of the following: A single dateObject A single string containing a date formatted accordingly to dateFormat An array of dateObject An array of string containing dates formatted accordingly to dateFormat The following actions; onChange (required), onClose, onOpen, will receive 3 parameters: An array of dateObjects A string formatted accordingly to dateFormat representing the last selected date The Flatpickr instance Styles Usage You can customise the look of your datetime input with the style attribute.

template:docs/forms/dropdowns.title: Dropdown Controls
template:docs/forms/dropdowns.text: Dropdown Controls The form drowdown component extends the ember power select component. As such you can pass any of the power select attributes Basic Usage Let's look at a basic example of using the drowdown component. It is always used in block format to enable flexible templationg of your options. Power select aims to be totally flexible and because of that it doesn't try to make strong assumptions about how you want to use it. e.g. two way bind the selected property. Instead it embraces DDAU (Data Down Actions Up) philosophy so data flow always is unidirectional and explicit. The onchange event must be handled in your template. This example shows the most common use, update the property on select. For this we can use the ember mut helper. Styles Usage You can customise the look of your dropdown with the style attribute.

template:docs/forms/index.title: Form
template:docs/forms/index.text: Form Model bound form This following example shows a form bound to an ember model demonstrating a variety of basic controls.

template:docs/forms/inputs.title: Form Inputs
template:docs/forms/inputs.text: Form Inputs The form input component extends from embers input component. As such you can pass any of the standard input attributes. Basic Usage Let's look at a basic example with two way binding on the value and an action on pressing enter Styles Usage You can customise the look of your input with the style attribute.

template:docs/forms/rows.title: Form Control Rows
template:docs/forms/rows.text: Form Control Rows The form control row is a display component to render form components like inputs inline. This component is just a presentational wrapper that will yeild content in a flexbox row. Like the control component, when rendering contextual components properties on the control, like model & disabled a passed though automatically to the input components. Inline Input Usage Let's look at a basic example of a name control where you require two inputs to sit alongside each other disabled Boolean Inline Button Usage Here's a common search box pattern where we need an inline button. Input Icon Usage Finally, you can use this component to prefix or suffix inputs with icons. Styles Usage You can customise the look of your rows with the style attribute. In this example the style attribute is inherited by the row from uxs-form.

template:docs/forms/textareas.title: Form Textareas
template:docs/forms/textareas.text: Form Textareas The form textarea component extends from embers textarea component. As such you can pass any of the standard textarea attributes Basic Usage Let's look at a basic example with two way binding on the value and an action on pressing enter Styles Usage You can customise the look of your textarea with the style attribute.

template:docs/layout/app.title: App
template:docs/layout/app.text: App The app component is used to wrap the contents of your application vertically. It's normally placed in the root application template. If fixedNav is true this container will add required padding to the top. Usage Properties Now explore the various properties available in this component:

template:docs/layout/header.title: Header
template:docs/layout/header.text: Header The header component is used to frame your page layouts. It combines a toolbar with a page title and familure action icons. Usage Head is a basic example of the header component. Tweak the title and style. Images You can add a background image to headers by specifing a path to the image either locally or via an full url. Contextual Components The Header component yeilds out the following contextual components: toolbar - title -

template:docs/layout/hero.title: Hero
template:docs/layout/hero.text: Hero The hero component is used to give your pages impact. Usage Contextual Components The Hero component has the following child components: heading Alias of uxs-heading content Alias of uxs-content button Alias of uxs-button button-link Alias of uxs-button-link

template:docs/layout/navbar.title: Navbar
template:docs/layout/navbar.text: Navbar The navbar component is used to render the main nav bar of your application. To see a full api check out the api page Usage The example below shows common usage of the nav bar with an embeded navigation list. Responsive Navigation This example shows using the mobile and desktop navigation components to provide a responsive menu.

template:docs/layout/pane.title: Panes
template:docs/layout/pane.text: Panes Pane components are used inside a window to layout content. To see a full api check out the api page Splash Layout The splash pane will position content in the middle of the window. This layout is also perfect for using in conjunction with a uxs-window with a background image. Single Layout The single layout places content in one large pane. Main & Aside Layout The main pane will take up the majority of the window width a side pane taking up the rest. On mobile devices panes will be stacked vertically with the aside pane appearing first. Split Layout Two columns will be spaced evenly. On mobile devices panes will be stacked vertically. Three Column Layout Three panes, an index, detail and aside. This layout is designed to display the following: A list of records Details for an individual record Actions & Meta data On mobile devices panes will be stacked vertically with the aide pane displayed first and the index pane hidden. Custom ordering on mobile The order panes are stacked on mobile views can be customised by setting the order attribute of a pane. The order attribute supports numbers from 1-9.

template:docs/layout/toolbar.title: Toolbar
template:docs/layout/toolbar.text: Toolbar The header component is used to frame your page layouts. Usage Contextual Components The Hero component has the following child components: back Alias of uxs-icon title Alias of uxs-subheading spacer Alias of uxs-div action Alias of uxs-icon Toolbar Search Styles You can customise the look of your toolbar with the style attribute.

template:docs/layout/window.title: Window
template:docs/layout/window.text: Window The window component is used to present horizontal content blocks as "panes". Usage Usage Styles Usage You can customise the look of your window with the style attribute. Notice how the text color will cascade from the window style.

template:docs/lists/_subheadings.title: List Subheadings
template:docs/lists/_subheadings.text: List Subheadings Subheadings are used to group list items. You can group a flat model collection with an addon like ember-cli-group-by. Example Styles Usage You can customise the look of your list subheadings by passing the style attribute to the list-subheading component. The default style will be either dark or white text depending on what contrasts with the parents list style. Properties The uxs-list-subheading component has the following properties: text* The subheading text. This can be passed in as the first positional parameter. String bordered Adds a border to the bottom of the list item. Default: false Boolean style Defined the color/style of the list. Default: white String

template:docs/lists/avatars.title: List Avatars
template:docs/lists/avatars.text: List Avatars Avatars are used to display infomation in a square or circle. Image Avatars Use images avatars to display an image. Icon Avatars Use Icon Avatars to display icons. Text Avatars Use Text Avatars to display text data Custom Text Avatars Use Text Avatars to display text data Stock Styles Examples Here's an example of the avatars in all stock styles: When used in lists the default style will be either dark or white text depending on what contrasts with the parents list style. Stock Size Examples Here's an example of the avatars in all stock sizes:

template:docs/lists/index.title: Lists
template:docs/lists/index.text: Lists Lists are used to display collections of records in a defined order. Example This is a basic lists using contextual child components. Styles Usage You can customise the look of your lists by passing the style attribute to either the list or the list-item component. Properties The uxs-list component has the following properties: style Defined the color/style of the list. Default: white String bordered Adds a border to the bottom of both child list items and subheadings. Boolean lines Fixes the height to accomodate 1-3 lines of content in the body of child list items. Default: 1 Number (1-3) Contextual Component The List component has the following child components: item Alias of subheading Alias of notice Alias of

template:docs/lists/items.title: List Items
template:docs/lists/items.text: List Items List items are used to render each item of you list. The items tend to contain 1 - 3 "columns" of data. These could be an avatar, text or actions. Basic Example This is a simple list containing just a title for each item. Adding more content This is a list contains some meta data and includes a bottom border. By defining the lines & border property on the list component, these properties are passed to each item and will set the height and bottom-border. Avatars and Actions This is a list that includes some horizontal layout for the avatar and item. We use the aside and body contextual components to split up each items layout. There is a variaty of avatar components you can use in lists including: image, text and icon avatars. See the for details.

template:docs/lists/notices.title: List Notices
template:docs/lists/notices.text: List Notices Lists can be used to highlight a list in certain contexts. e.g. an active filter. To see a full list of arguments check out the api page Usage Here's a basic list notice at the top of a list. Icons and Actions List notices can also include icons and actions e.g. to clear a filter. Testable Elements This component provides the following test selectors. data-test-list-notice data-test-list-notice-icon data-test-list-notice-text data-test-list-notice-action Styles Usage You can customise the look of your list notices by passing the style attribute to the list-subheading component.

template:docs/lists/subheadings.title: List Subheadings
template:docs/lists/subheadings.text: List Subheadings Subheadings are used to group list items. You can group a flat model collection with an addon like ember-cli-group-by. Usage Let's look at a basic example. You can play around with some of the arguments in this demo. To see a full list check out the api page Yield Examples The subheading can yield subcomponents to provide some more functionality like toggles and icons. To use the yeild component make sure you set the yield argument to true. Stock Style Examples Here's an example of the subheading in all it's stock styles:

template:docs/navigation/tabs.title: Tabs
template:docs/navigation/tabs.text: Tabs Tabs organize content across different screens, data sets, and other interactions. The uxs-tabs component yields tab items or item-links for each tab you want to display Usage Let's look at a basic example. You can play around with some of the arguments in this demo. To see a full list check out the api page Explanation, uxs-tabs is the wrapping component The contextual component tab.link is an alias to embers core link-to component. So you can use tab items that act link links. The demo.item component lets you render tab items that are not links. So you can bind action events to them instead.

template:docs/patterns.title: Patterns
template:docs/patterns.text: Patterns Here's a summary of the patterns we use and encourage authors to follow when extending this addon. BEM All the Things Make Use of ember-test-selectors Create Accessible Components Build Components on Top of the Shared Mixins Use Ember Prop Types BEM All the Things Use BEM Sauce to add some BEM sugar to your components. Make Use of ember-test-selectors Test selectors enable better element selectors in Ember.js tests. When designing components we try and use nested test selectors inline with the BEM style. All components should allow the passing of a name parameter that will be used as the value for all test selectors. This helps authors target to elements when multiple instances exist. In the case of components rendered in loops, either use model id's or a zero based index. Use Closure Actions Stop bubbling actions and use closure actions Create Accessible Components Write this Addons ember-basic-dropdown This is a very minimal dropdown. That means that it is agnostic about what it is going to contain. It is intended to be a building block for more complex components but is perfectly usable. It is by example the addon on which ember-power-select or ember-paper's menu component are built upon. ember-bem-sauce ember-bem-sauce helps you write BEM components. Make your templates cleaner with the help of the bem helper and the bem component mixin. By defining all your components modifiers in one place you will dry up your template files. ember-composable-helpers Composable helpers for Ember that enables more declarative templating. ember-moment moment.js template helpers and computed property macros for Ember ember-cli-string-helpers Set of the String helpers extracted from DockYard's ember-composable-helpers. ember-cli-sass ember-cli-sass uses Dart Sass to preprocess your ember-cli app's files and provides support for source maps and include paths. It provides support for the common use case for Ember.js projects: ember-power-select Ember Power Select is a select component written in Ember with a focus in flexibility and extensibility. It is designed to work well with the way we build Ember apps, so it plays nicely with promises, ember-concurrency's tasks, ember-data collections and follows idiomatic patterns. ember-cp-validations An EmberJS validation framework that is completely and utterly computed property based. ember-flatpickr This is an Ember addon that wraps the date picker flatpickr. It uses ember-cli-node-assets to pull in flatpickr from npm. ember-modal-dialog The ember-modal-dialog addon provides components to implement modal dialogs throughout an Ember application using a simple, consistent pattern. ember-svg-jar The best way to embed SVG images into your Ember application. The viewer is available at: [http://localhost:4200/ember-svg-jar/index.html] ember-test-selectors Enabling better element selectors in Ember.js tests ember-tether Tether an element to another element in the DOM ember-toggle Checkbox based Toggle Switch component with swipe/drag support for Ember. ember-cli-addon-doc Easy documentation for Ember addons.

template:docs/quickstart.title: Quickstart
template:docs/quickstart.text: Quickstart This quickstart guide will get you going with a docs site for your brand new addon. 1 - Install the addon. yarn add ember-ux-sauce2 - Install ember-cli-sass yarn add ember-cli-sass3 - Add styles to your app.scss file @import "uxs";4 - Restart Ember Server Customising Sass You can control much of the UX toolkits look and feel with sass variables. To override the defaults: 1 - Create a new sass file to hold your custom variables touch app/styles/_settings.uxs.scss2 - Add it to app.scss before you include the uxs files @import "settings.uxs"; @import "uxs";3 - (Optional) Include uxs tools.functions file so it can be used in your settings in settings.uxs.scss @import "uxs/tools.functions";4 - Override variables @import "uxs/tools.functions"; $c-primary: #2682C4; $c-accent : #4A74B7; $c-success: #8FC93A; $c-error : #D84F4F; $c-warning: #FFC031; $c-dark : #001021;

template:docs/settings/typography.title: Typography
template:docs/settings/typography.text: Typography UX Sauce comes with a default typography system to present your design and content as clearly and efficiently as possible. You can use the base type component uxs-type to present text around your application. The following page will demonstrate some of the arguments. To see a full list check out the api page. Type Sizes The default system provides 6 different sizes, from giant to tiny. Medium is defined as 18px and the other sizes are scaled relativly by 1.618 (The golden ratio). You can preview different scales using Type Scale. SCSS Defaults The following shows the default sizes we define in the uxs settings. All of these can be overwritten in you own app scss. // Base Sizes $type-scale: 1.618; $type-base: 18px; // Our default 6 sizes $s-giant: scale($type-base, 3, $type-scale)!default; $s-huge: scale($type-base, 2, $type-scale)!default; $s-large: scale($type-base, 1, $type-scale)!default; $s-medium: $type-base!default; $s-small: scale($type-base, -1, $type-scale)!default; $s-tiny: scale($type-base, -2, $type-scale)!default; // Hash of sizes used thoughout system as modifiers $defaultSizes: ( "giant" : $s-giant, "huge" : $s-huge, "large" : $s-large, "medium": $s-medium, "small" : $s-small, "tiny" : $s-tiny, ); Line Heights Line hights are set to increments of the baseline size (25px). The default values are shown below: /** The grid height used thoughout the system **/ $baseline: 25px!default; /* Line heights of defined sizes */ $defaultLineHights: ( "giant" : $baseline*4, "huge" : $baseline*3, "large" : $baseline*2, "medium": $baseline*1, "small" : $baseline*1, "tiny" : $baseline*1, ); Type Weights The typography system comes with 3 weights; bold, medium and light. These can also be customised in the scss settings, you can also choose different typefaces for each weight. SCSS Defaults /** Typographic weights **/ $type-body-family: 'Lato', sans-serif!default; $type-body-weight: 400!default; $type-light-family: 'Lato', sans-serif!default; $type-light-weight: 300!default; $type-bold-family: 'Lato', sans-serif!default; $type-bold-weight: 700!default; /** Hash of sizes used thoughout system as modifiers **/ $defaultWeights: ( "bold" : 700, "normal": 400, "light" : 300, ); Text Alignment The align attribute has 4 options. Type Styles Applying a style to the uxs-type component will apply a background color to the text. The color of the text will be either dark or light, depending on the background color you have selected. Type Colors To define a specific type text color you can use the color argument. SCSS Mixins When you need to create your own custom css styles or modifiers you can use the following mixins to keep things consistant. Mixin Description body-type Set type and weight to default style light-body-type Set type and weight to light style bold-body-type Set type and weight to bold style heading-font-size Sets the size and height of text for headings. subheading-font-size Sets the size and height of text for subheadings. content-font-size Sets the size and height of text for content text. detail-font-size Sets the size and height of text for detail text. type-heading As well as size and height, also sets weight and style for headings. type-subheading As well as size and height, also sets weight and style for subheadings. type-content As well as size and height, also sets weight and style for content text. type-detail As well as size and height, also sets weight and style for detail text. truncate-text Truncate text to one line. ($boundary:100%) link Style text as a link. ($color:$c-dark, $hover-color:$c-primary) label Style text as a label.

template:docs/typography/index.title: Typography
template:docs/typography/index.text: Typography Common typography components. Text A basic component to render text with. It defaults to body text, but by using the arguments it can be customized. To see a full list check out the api page. Headings A component to render headings. Using the arguments it can be customized. To see a full list check out the api page. Subheadings A component to render subheadings. Using the arguments it can be customized. To see a full list check out the api page. Content A component to render content text. Using the arguments it can be customized. To see a full list check out the api page. Details A component to render detail text. Using the arguments it can be customized. To see a full list check out the api page.

template:docs/typography/lists.title: Lists
template:docs/typography/lists.text: Lists List typography components Ordered Lists Ordered lists are used to present items in a sequence. Play around with the argiments in the demo. To see a full list check out the api page. Unordered Lists Unordered lists are used to present items in a list. Play around with the argiments in the demo. To see a full list check out the api page. template:docs/typography/tables.title: Tables
template:docs/typography/tables.text: Tables Table all the things! Tabular Data Example This example shows using tables to represent tabular data. Rows can be grouped by sections and certain rows highlighted. To see a full list of arguments check out the api page. Record Tables The record table layout is a more traditional style of table layout, used to represent a collection of resources. Used this in place of a uxs-list where appropriate.
